text.text: SIMIV (Thomson) Personnal computer Second 1984 / 1986 Cartridge, floppy, tape Joystick, keyboard, optic pencil

text.name: sys_description
text.text: MO5 and TO7 were created in 1984 by the French company Thomson, with their 'Computing for All' plan aimed at equipping schools and homes. It comes with a cassette player and an optical pencil allowing you to draw directly on the Television. It was followed in 1986 by MO6, TO8, and T09. The T08 equipped a Motorola 6809E at 1 MHz, 256 to 512 KB of RAM, 160×200 (320×200 max) display, 16 colors among 4096, 25 frames per second, and potential for three digital music scores.
